Text: The Arab's Mouth is a 1990 play by Ann-Marie MacDonald which she later revised to create "Belle Moral", at which point most of the Arabic references were cut.

Text: The Arab's Mouth:  The title refers to a shape found on a stone by the central character—a circle or zero.

Text: The Arab's Mouth:  First staged at the Factory Theatre in Toronto, MacDonald lightly revised the play for publication, at which point it was staged at Theatre Kingston in Kingston, Ontario.

Text: The Arab's Mouth:  It is now out of print, having been superseded by "Belle Moral".
